page.title: 10LIFE IN CHILDSWICKHAM, 1985
page.content: Childswickham, a market gardening village, situated where the Cotswolds meet the Vale of Evesham, has changed considerably over the years. Houses have replaced small orchards. With the demise of small holdings and the growth in mechanised farming, most workers commute daily to the towns. Several smallholdings and two market gardening families still produce fruit and vegetables. Loss of a post office, shop and school, together with increased price of properties has resulted in changes to village life. Life revolves around the Church, Village Hall and Public House. The Women's Institute, Wives Group and Evergreens for the elderly, meet in the Village Hall where Bingo, Whist Drives, Bridge and Snooker are also played. A baby clinic and mobile library are also provided.
